alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Wenatchee Area; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 5:34AM PST until December 26 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations for the Methow Valley, the Okanogan Valley, and the Okanogan Highlands between 2 and 5 inches. For the Wenatchee area, total snow accumulations between 0.5 and 3 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Sherman Pass, Mazama, Conconully, Entiat, Omak, Bridgeport, Nespelem, Number 1 Canyon, Brewster, Tonasket, Chesaw Road, Loup Loup Pass, Inchelium, Twisp, Oroville, Boulder Creek Road, Highway 20 Wauconda Summit, Winthrop, Number 2 Canyon, Okanogan, Pangborn Airport, Wauconda, Cashmere, Methow, Republic, Disautel Pass, Wenatchee, and Chelan. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery roads conditions around the Wenatchee area. Expect winter driving conditions late Monday night through early Tuesday morning in Okanogan and Ferry counties.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel

area.areaDesc: Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Wenatchee Area; Western Okanogan County
